Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father Scott Haig, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER MARSHALL.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father Scott Haig, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y.  10007.

Council Member Marshall moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Harrison:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number C990640 ZSQ, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Zoning Resolution Special Permit, Queens (990640ZSQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Members Reed and Perkins:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number 20000294PPM shall be subject to review by the Council.

By Council Members Carrion, Rivera and Foster:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Application Number 20000411PPX shall be subject to review by the Council.

By Council Member Perkins:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk cafe located at 1090 Amsterdam Avenue, Strokos Deli, Manhattan, Community Board 5 shall be subject to review by the Council.  (Application No. 20005216TCM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution recognizing October, 2000 as Sudden Infant Death Syndrome Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome Awareness Month, October 2000

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the month of October, 2000 as "Breast Health Awareness Month" in the City of New York.

Resolution recognizing the month of October, 2000 as "Italian Heritage and Culture Month" in the City of New York and acknowledging the tremendous contributions that Italian-Americans have made to this City and nation.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Italian Heritage and Culture Month, October 2000

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to acknowledge the primacy of Antonio Meucci in the invention of the telephone and declare his moral vindication for this great achievement in the service of science and all mankind.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Acknowledge the primacy of Antonio Meucci

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the violence against the people of Israel and the State of Israel, and calling upon Palestinian Authority Chairman Yasir Arafat to seize the moment and call upon the Palestinians to cease and desist from perpetrating aggressive acts of hatred and terrorism and promote a unified effort to control the urges of war and foster peace and cohesion in the State of Israel.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Condemning the violence against the people of Israel.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the President of the United States and the U.S. House of Representatives and Senate to take a firm position that Jerusalem should remain unequivocally united under Israeli sovereignty, that no part of Jerusalem should be divided, and that the Temple Mount is a holy site that belongs to Jerusalem and the people of Israel.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: President of U.S. to take a firm position that no part of Jerusalem be divided.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that ambulance services operating within the city of New York be equipped with epinephrine auto-injector devices.
A Local Law in relation to a street name, Rev. Charles Britt Way, Borough of The Bronx.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Rev. Charles Britt Way, Bronx

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Board of Education to restructure its contracting requirements and increase its supplier pool in relation to food service providers, thereby eliminating the number of contracts that continue to be awarded to suppliers under federal indictment for bid-rigging.
Items.MatterName: Food Service Providers, Board of Education

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to fees collected by tow operators who remove vehicles under the DARP and ROTOW programs.
Items.MatterName: Fees collected by tow operators, DARP & ROTOW Programs

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings to investigate the nature and extent of the resources and special support the Boy Scouts of America receives from the City of New York and/or its uniformed forces, and explore whether such resources would be better spent on organizations that do not discriminate based on sexual orientation.
Items.MatterName: Boy Scouts of America Support, Hold Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings to examine the recent federal district court decision in the case of Henrietta v. Giuliani, et al., in which it was found that the Human Resources Administration Division of AIDS Services and Income Support (DASIS) is in violation of the federal Americans With Disabilities Act, the federal Rehabilitation Act, New York State Social Services Law, and the Constitution of the State of New York in failing to provide adequate services to poor people with AIDS as required under Local Law No. 49, and to make recommendations that will assist the magistrate judge appointed to monitor and oversee DASIS's operations
Resolution calling upon all stadium owners and operators within New York City to grant greater access to female sports teams so as to encourage the advancement of female athletics.

Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to hold a hearing on the need for and lack of sufficient outreach and notification, including to non-English speaking residents, on the rule changes proposed by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) regarding the Division of Alternative Management Program (DAMP) buildings, because of the dramatic impact these rules will have on tenants and the availability of affordable housing in this city.
Items.MatterName: Need for and lack of sufficient outreach notification, HPD, DAMP

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority New York City Transit to abandon its plans to adopt a new set of performance indicators until it has consulted with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority Inspector General, the New York City Transit Riders Council, the Comptroller, government legislative bodies, and invited greater public participation in the formulations of these indicators.
Items.MatterName: MTA to abandon set of performance indicators

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings on the issues regarding the clean-up of crime scenes.
A Local Law in relation to a street name, Kathy Kiernan Way, Borough of Staten Island.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Kathy Kiernan Way, Staten Island

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring plastic bags used for waste disposal to be placed within containers.
Items.MatterName: Requiring plastic bags used for waste disposal to be placed within containers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to provide more funding for research to perfect a more accurate screening test for ovarian cancer.
A Local Law in relation to a bridge name, The Ramblersville-Hawtree Memorial Bridge, Borough of Queens.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, The Ramblersville-Hawtree Memorial Bridge, Queens

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Commissioner of Education to amend Section 144.11 of the Regulations of the Commissioner of Education to allow for broader methods of reducing class size under New York State's Early Grade Class Size Reduction Program.
Items.MatterName: Early Grade Class Size Reduction Program, NYS

Items.Title: Section 202 Supportive Housing Program for the Elderly, Highbridge Senior Housing, 1410-1430 Plimpton Avenue, Bronx, Community District No. 4, Council District No. 16.
Items.MatterName: Supportive Housing Program, 1410-1430 Plimpton Ave, Bronx
